markdown.markdown:
I. `The Tasks, Models and Compute` Thought Process
II. **Tasks**: Predictive vs Generative Tasks
III. **Models**: Evolution of LLMs - from a size-centric view
IV. **Compute**: Architecting LLM Applications in Cloud
- The Mental Model for Hosting in Cloud
- The Compute Environments in AWS
- Marriage between **Models** and **Compute**
V. Conclusion
## I.The Initial Thought Process - The below thought process diagram is a simplified first step to a Model Selection. - I have kept the following thoughts out of scope, for now. But for a reader, they may be super important - Do you need domain-specific models (relevant if your application is run in healthcare/finance/law etc.,)? - Why does it have to be just one of the 2 options - `Purpose-built/Customized LLM` and `Prompt-based General Purpose LLM`? - Why not a `Prompt-based General Purpose LLM customized with RAG or Fine-tuning` ![](./images/opensource_llm/initial_thought_process.png) Source: Author's take | Open for debate ## II. The Debate on `Tasks` ![](./images/opensource_llm/the_tasks.png) Source: My fav NLP Researcher / SpaCy Founder - Ines Motwani in a PyCon'24 ## III. The Debate on `Models`: Evolution of LLMs - from the pov of their Memory Footprint ![](./images/opensource_llm/the_mental_model_for_open_source_llms_3.png) Source: Author's take | Open for debate --- ![](./images/opensource_llm/quantizations_model_size.png) Source: Author's take | Open for debate
For a better read on Quantizations: Refer [Introduction to Post Training Quantization Medium Article](https://towardsdatascience.com/introduction-to-weight-quantization-2494701b9c0c) ## IV. The Debate on `Compute`: Architecting LLM Applications in Cloud

A Cloud Agnostic View

![](./images/opensource_llm/compute_environments_in_cloud_2.png) Source: Author's take | Open for debate ---

An AWS-specific View

![](./images/opensource_llm/compute_environments_in_aws.png) Source: Author's take | Open for debate ### The Marriage between Compute Environments and LLMs

Different Sized LLMs and their Compute Options in AWS

![](./images/opensource_llm/size_of_llms_vs_compute_env_2.png) Source: Author's take | Open for debate ## V. Conclusion - In this blog, we have seen the different LLM sizes out in the market and their compute capacity needed above. - ToDo: In a future blog, I could focus also on the right sized EC2/ SageMaker instances for different LLMs discussed above. - ToDo: It would also be a good continuation of this blog to focus on `Efficient LLM Inferencing` options like below ``` llama.cpp ollama mistral.rs vLLM PyTorch Mobile Tensorflow Lite Apple Core ML Windows DirectML ```
